page.title: 05Anglicans in Colden Common
page.content: The Anglican Church was built in 1843 to cater for the growing settlement of Colden Common.It is located one mile from the village centre and separated from it by a busy main road. The Church reflects many of the problems facing the Church of England in 1985.An average of 30 people attend regularly,rising to 70 on religious festivals.Following the retirement of the last vicar,the parish has been without a full-time incumbent for over a year.The newly appointed vicar is anxious to see the Church playing a more positive role in the community, being readily available to all parishoners whether regular worshippers or not.
